summary: During the 2021 filing season, IRS struggled with an unprecedented workload. The agency began with a backlog of 8 million returns from the prior year. It reduced that backlog, but as of Dec. 2021, IRS still had about 10.5 million new 2021 returns to process. For the 2022 filing season, IRS will need to process millions of remaining 2021 returns alongside incoming returns, and may...
title: Tax Filing: Preliminary Observations on IRS's Efforts to Address Persistent Challenges
